text: Douglas Michael Costle (July 27, 1939 â€“ January 13, 2019) was an American politician and environmentalist. He was one of the key figures of the creation of the United States Environmental Protection Agency (EPA). He would later become EPA Administrator from 1977 to 1981 during the Jimmy Carter presidency. Costle was born in Long Beach, California. He studied at Harvard University and at the University of Chicago. Costle died on January 13, 2019 in McLean, Virginia from complications of a stroke, aged 79. ==References== ==Other websites== * EPA History Website * EPA Oral History Webpage Category:1939 births Category:2019 deaths Category:Deaths from stroke Category:Administrators of the United States Environmental Protection Agency Category:Lawyers from California Category:American environmentalists Category:Politicians from California Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians
